image.altText: Dark smokes rises from a multi-story medical building

props.synopsis: The conflict between Iran and Israel has entered its seventh day, with no sign of de-escalation, as the two sides trade missiles and Donald Trump refuses to rule out US involvement.

title.children: Israeli hospital hit by Iranian missile, Israel strikes Iranian nuclear facility

image.altText: The legs of three Iranian police officers in khakis are seen behind clear riot shields with "POLICE" written on them in gold.

props.synopsis: Israel's slick PR machine hits overdrive when the fighting starts, but getting information from Iran is almost impossible.

title.children: Why you're seeing much more news coming out of Tel Aviv than Tehran

image.altText: Mohammad Azizi standing in front of an wall poster with writing in Farsi, and two ducks. He's wearing a traditional headwrap.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians are stranded in Iran and Israel as the conflict enters its seventh day, with airspace closures complicating evacuations. But a small group has managed to evacuate Israel via cruise ship.

title.children: Thousands of Australians stranded as small group escapes Iran-Israel conflict

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Ms Patterson's lawyer has told the jury in her triple-murder trial she emerged "unscathed" from cross-examination, as his closing address came to an end.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer urges jury to reject 'convoluted' triple-murder case

image.altText: A police forensic officer in a jump suit and face mask stands inside the door of a house at night.

props.synopsis: The murder of a Perth man at the hands of a teenager during a planned meeting for bondage sex is described by his own lawyer as one of the most "depraved and monstrous murders" Western Australia has ever seen. WARNING: This story contains details readers may find distressing.

title.children: Killing of AFL masseur one of WA's most 'depraved and monstrous murders'

image.altText: A person holds a can of tear gas.

props.synopsis: In the haze of gas and smoke, it can be hard to make sense of the chaos on Los Angeles streets. This is what it looks like when a progressive city in Trump's America is forced to turn on itself.

title.children: Police declared protesters 'have taken the street'. Then the scene erupted

image.altText: close up side profile image of vladimir putin while he smiles with his mouth closed

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy would only happen at a final phase of negotiations "so as not to sit there and divide things up endlessly, but to put an end to it".

title.children: Putin says NATO rearmament not a threat, willing to meet Zelenskyy

image.altText: Iranian flags fly as fire and smoke rise from an Israeli attack on an oil depot in Tehran

props.synopsis: Authorities in Iran have regularly restricted internet access for the country's roughly 90 million people since last week.

title.children: Iranians 'terrified' as internet blacked out amid Israeli strikes

image.altText: Workers

props.synopsis: Employment decreased by about 2,000 people in May, coming off an unexpectedly strong jobs surge in April.

title.children: Employment falls by 2,500, unemployment steady as thousands leave workforce

image.altText: Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, Georgia.

props.synopsis: Adriana Smith was pronounced brain dead in February but due to Georgia abortion laws, doctors say they were forced to keep her on life support for months.

title.children: Brain-dead US woman kept alive to support pregnancy dies after c-section

image.altText: A satellite GIF of clouds moving over the Australian continent between March 13 and March 31

props.synopsis: The areas over the ocean where storm clouds form have dwindled by up to 3 per cent in the past two decades, new research led by NASA shows.

title.children: Earth's shrinking cloud cover may hold the key to climate mystery

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: Former political staffer Bruce Lehrmann has pleaded not guilty to one count of motor vehicle stealing in Tasmania.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann pleads not guilty to stealing car in Tasmania

image.altText: Elinay cosmetic surgery centre 2025-06-17 10:06:00

props.synopsis: A civil tribunal hears the patient was "drifting in and out of consciousness" and had to be taken to hospital with a damaged artery.

title.children: Doctor deregistered after botched face lift at suburban clinic

image.altText: The city of perth's skyline with the Swan River in the foreground, with two trees on either side framing the shot,

props.synopsis: Western Australia's population surges past 3 million people, with the state taking the gong for the fastest-growing jurisdiction in the country.

title.children: This state's population is growing faster than anywhere in Australia

image.altText: Roger Cook and Rita Saffioti look down at budget papers

props.synopsis: This year's budget cements the state as the nation's economic engine room as West Australians brace for higher power bills amid rising global instability.

title.children: Breaking: Power bill credits scrapped as WA budget reveals $2.4 billion surplus

image.altText: A man sits in front of a store.

props.synopsis: While Israel's war with Iran continues, Gazans are begging for help, saying their suffering is being ignored because of the new conflict.

title.children: 'The massacres continue in silence': Gazans fear being forgotten amid focus on Iran

image.altText: Julianne Moore puts her arm around a sad-looking Sydney Sweeney as the pair lie in bed.

props.synopsis: While the genre-crossing Echo Valley can never decide quite what it wants to be, it excels as a B-grade thriller where the greatest threat to your life is coming from inside the house.

title.children: Echo Valley, starring Sydney Sweeney, will leave you gobsmacked

image.altText: A close up photo of a man and a woman standing in front of a shop smiling

props.synopsis: A NSW man has been spared prison after admitting he was responsible for a high-speed crash that killed a couple near the NSW-Victoria border.

title.children: 'Gutted' young driver avoids jail over crash that killed couple

image.altText: A view from the ocean of a small town, boats at dock and forest-covered hills.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has halted funding to the Cook Islands over what it considers the small Pacific nation's deepening ties with China.

title.children: New Zealand halts funding to the Cook Islands over China deals

image.altText: Karen Read Trial

props.synopsis: A US jury has found Karen Read not guilty of second-degree murder after she was accused of fatally striking her police officer boyfriend in a case which gained international attention.

title.children: Karen Read found not guilty for police officer's death

image.altText: grey station wagon and motobike stopped on the road to see orange and white plumes of smoke from the volcano

props.synopsis: The backlog of flights delayed or cancelled because of the eruption is expected to take some time to clear despite some airlines resuming services.

title.children: Bali holiday-makers face days-long flight delays after volcanic eruption

image.altText: A red sold sticker across a for sale sign outside a house with a large front yard on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Property prices are tipped to hit record highs in 2025-26, creating more pain for first home buyers and profit for sellers.

title.children: Would-be home buyers receive 'reality check' from house price forecasts

image.altText: Tim Ryan scores a try for the Reds against the Brumbies.

props.synopsis: Super Rugby AUS — to act as the third tier of the men's professional game in Australia — makes sense, but it must steer clear of the pitfalls that saw previous attempts at such a tournament bite the dust.

title.children: Rugby Australia's new domestic competition must avoid familiar hurdles

image.altText: A young woman in high-vis smiles.

props.synopsis: Where are all the tradies? The construction industry says there's a massive shortage and it comes down to young people being told they have to go to university.

title.children: Why is there a 'massive shortage' of tradies?

image.altText: Three children in high-vis jackets sit on a log facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: The latest Australian Early Development Census results show we are going backwards in all five key areas, sparking calls for urgent funding.

title.children: Almost half of children are not on track by the time they start school

image.altText: Richard Marles for Greber

props.synopsis: This is not a normal American administration and these are not normal times. The notion this generation of Australians can stand as aloof observers of far-off events could soon be tested.

title.children: Australia's status as an aloof observer of faraway events could soon be tested

image.altText: Lions coach Chris Fagan celebrates while walking through a guard of honour by his players

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions have made a habit of breaking hoodoos under Chris Fagan — and they are determined to tick off the final item on their list.

title.children: Hoodoo breaking Lions out to end their Geelong curse

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government was unaware for almost two years that 11 massive US military fuel tanks were being built unlawfully on Darwin Harbour, it has been revealed during NT budget estimates.

title.children: Unlawful build of US military fuel tanks not realised for almost two years

image.altText: Vision shows damage to the Northland shopping centre and emergency services gathered outside.

props.synopsis: Shocked witnesses say they heard screams before seeing a car driving past them at speed inside a shopping centre in Melbourne's north on Wednesday,

title.children: Man arrested after car driven through a Melbourne shopping centre

image.altText: Jason Haines, St John's Care

props.synopsis: A Canberra emergency food relief charity says scammers impersonated it on social media and stole people's Centrelink payments after offering interest free loans.

title.children: Community's poorest lose MyGov payments in 'ingenious' charity scam

image.altText: James O'Connor of the Wallabies kicks in a rugby Test match

props.synopsis: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt announces a 36-player squad for Australia's Test match against Fiji.

title.children: O'Connor a notable omission from Wallabies ahead of Fiji Test

image.altText: A young man wearing a green Canberra Raiders jersey stands on a football field looking serious with on e hand on his hip.

props.synopsis: The NRL's most demonstratively passionate and self-proclaimed "emotional" coach, Ricky Stuart, will have an extra reason to reach for the tissues this week, as he watches his son make his first-grade debut.

title.children: 'He's earned his spot': Ricky Stuart's son to debut for the Raiders

image.altText: Luai1

props.synopsis: Reuben Cotter says he was not eye-gouged by Jarome Luai in State of Origin II in Perth, after the NSW five-eighth was handed a fine for contrary conduct.

title.children: Cotter claims he wasn't eye-gouged by Luai in Origin II

image.altText: A woman with dark curly hair sitting on the floor looking at her phone

props.synopsis: Experts say calling someone out of the blue is the modern-day equivalent of dropping in unannounced.

title.children: Why an unexpected call is like dropping in unannounced
